intro: Gymnolomia linearis, commonly known as the slender gymnolomia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its linear, elongated leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Gymnolomia linearis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
